page.title: 02Description of Manningtree
page.content: Manningtree is a small town on the borders of Essex and Suffolk, surrounded by villages; Lawford, Bradfield, Ardleigh, Mistley and Great Bromley. Manningtree is smaller than the other villages and is a maze of small roads and houses. It has been on the map for hundreds of years, being mentioned in Shakespeare as being famous for its feasts. There are two Primary Schools in Lawford, Lawford and Highfields while the secondary school, situated in Lawford is called Manningtree School. Down by the river there are boats moored and several warehouses with a workshop and large storage area owned by Jewson. The Stour Estuary is peaceful and swans congregate near the Maltings at Mistley, the river itself is alive with small boats. By Neil John, 13 years old.
